data.title: Ilulissat Icefjord
data.text: Ilulissat Icefjord () is a fjord in western Greenland. Located 250 km north of the Arctic Circle, the Ilulissat Icefjord runs west from the Greenland ice sheet to Disko Bay just south of the town of Ilulissat. Ilulissat Icefjord was declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 2004 because of its natural beauty and the importance of the fast-moving Jakobshavn Glacier in developing the current scientific understanding of anthropogenic climate change. <mapframe text="Map of Ilulissat Icefjord" width=300 height=300 zoom=7 latitude=69.15 longitude=-50.2>
